intro: Chorizanthe spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaved choris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its structure includes a basal rosette of leaves with upright flowering stems that bear numerous bract-like structures. Chorizanthe spathulata is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
